b: ^The cat seems very unhappy, desperately trying to get your attention...
^The cat looks at you longingly, wanting affection...
^The cat seems restless, looking for something to do...
^The cat looks at you with hungry eyes and meows desperately...
^The cat purrs, but keeps looking at the food bowl...
^The cat purrs happily, enjoying your attention.
^The cat tries to play, but seems more interested in food right now.
^The cat excitedly chases after your fingers!

food_bowl: ^The cat watches the food bowl intently.

c-0: ^You put some food into the bowl. The cat happily munches away.

b: ^The cat meows sadly and keeps staring at the bowl.
^The cat loses interest and walks away.

c-0: ^You close the door and try to sleep.
^Suddenly, you wake up, hearing sad meowing behind the door...
^The kitten happily enters your room. Jumping onto your bed, he purrs and curls up next to you.
^The sound persists, but become more distant as you drift off to sleep.
c-1: ^After a few minutes of guilt, you get up and open the door.
^The kitten triumphantly enters and claims his spot on your bed.
^It takes a long time, but eventually you fall asleep while the cat stays near the door.
^The kitten follows you to bed immediately...
^He purrs and curls up next to your pillow.

night_1: ^You feel exhausted after work. You've spent the whole evening trying to please your new furry roommate, and now sleep is the only thing on your mind.
^You enter the bedroom and hear the soft patter of tiny paws behind you - the kitten is following you.
^Close the door behind you. Let him sleep on the couch.

c-0: ^You close the door right before he can get through, and then lie down on your bed.
^The pitiful meowing from the living room makes it hard to fall asleep.
^Ignore him. He needs to get used to this.
^You try hard not to block out the sound. It barely helps - the quiet whimpering follows you even in your dreams.
^You wake up to your alarm and find that the kitten spent the night behind the couch in the living room.
^He emerges covered in dust and greets you with a demanding "meow".
c-1: ^You open the door, and the kitten darts inside like lightning, then rubs against your legs.
^You get back in bed while he carefully investigates the room.
^In the darkness, you try to keep an eye on him for a while but quickly fall asleep.
^The kitten immediately runs in after you and starts exploring the room.
^You lie down and watch him in the darkness for a while, but quickly fall asleep.

Night_1_with_cat: ^You wake up to something... or someone trying to pull your blanket off.
^You pull it back, but whoever it is, they're strong.
^A chill runs down your spine. Suddenly, something bites your favorite toe.
^Barely resisting the urge to scream, you reach for the lamp.
^The kitten sits on the bed, looking at you with innocent eyes. His pupils are so dilated you can barely see the iris.
^Looks like he decided to play with your feet.
^You exhale, turn off the light, and try to go back to sleep.
^On the edge between sleep and wakefulness, only one thought buzzes in your head...
^"How can such a tiny thing be so strong?"
^When the annoying alarm finally wakes you, the kitten is sleeping sweetly at your feet.
Morning_1: ^New day. You fill the bowl with extra food and head off to work.
^In the evening, you hurry home to your little friend.
cat_couch: ^The cat is comfortably lying on a surface.
^He shouldn't be there. Shoo him away

c-0: ^The cat purrs contentedly, enjoying the attention.

b: ^You manage to place him on the floor, but he tries to bite your fingers in a process.
^The cat purrs as you put him on the floor.

c-2: ^The cat gives you an annoyed look but jumps down from the surface.

beginning: ^It was a long day. You're tired from work and your best friend couldn't join you for the evening.
^You're heading back to your lonely house, thinking about...

c-0: ^ Maybe you can check out that new show everyone's talking about.
c-1: ^ You can already hear that cold beer in the fridge calling your name.
c-2: ^ You still need to beat that annoying boss. Blade of... what was his name again?
g-0: ^Yes. The evening probably won't be that bad after all.
^Here's your house. And your porch. And your door. And your box.
^Wait a minute.... A box? You didn't order anything.
^It's not Christmas and it's not your birthday. Maybe you should call the police?
^Suddenly the box cries out in a thin voice. And then you hear scratching. Before you have a chance to react... It opens.
^A cat! Somebody left a box with a cat on your porch.

box_action: ^Look for a person who left the box
^Leave the box outside and proceed with the initial plan

c-0: ^ You look around — the street is empty. That person is probably already far away.
c-1: ^ Well... That's not really an option here. We still have a game to play, don't we?

night_2: ^You're already in bed, ready for sleep. The house is quiet... perhaps too quiet.

b: ^Just as you're about to drift off, a long, haunting yowl echoes through the apartment.
^You look up to see the kitten sitting in your bedroom doorway, staring at you intensely.

c-0: ^You drag yourself out of the warm bed.
^His bowl isn't completely empty, but you can see the bottom.
^You add a small scoop. He trills happily and trots off to eat.
^When you return to bed, he joins you, purring contentedly.
c-1: ^You return to bed. Throughout the night, your dreams are haunted by increasingly creative vocalizations.

b: ^You sit up in bed and see a dark blur racing around your room - from the dresser to the windowsill, then onto your desk.
^The kitten suddenly jumps on your bed, eyes wide and glowing in the dark, his tail puffed up like a bottle brush.
^Try to calm him down with pets

c-0: ^At least he's gentler now than during your first night together.
c-1: ^You pull the covers over your head. Is this a good idea?..

b: ^Trying to get comfortable, you feel like... you're being watched.
^You open your eyes to find the kitten sitting on your chest, completely still, just... staring.
^His tail twitches occasionally. The silence is unnerving.

c-0: ^You reach up to scratch behind his ears. He immediately melts into a purring puddle.
^After a few minutes of attention, he settles down beside you.
c-1: ^You gently try to shift him off your chest. He becomes a lead weight.
^You try again. He somehow gets heavier.
^This continues until you give up and pet him instead.

b: ^The day was good - you played together, he ate well, and got plenty of attention.
^...only to wake up in the middle of the night to a strange sound.
^You reach for the lamp, squinting in the sudden light.
^The kitten sits at the foot of your bed, his back perfectly straight, tail raised in alert attention.
^His eyes are fixed intently on the corner of the room, head moving slightly as if tracking something.
^You look at the corner. Nothing's there - just the meeting point of two walls and the ceiling.
^He makes that strange chirping sound again, not taking his eyes off the empty corner.

c-0: ^He turns to you, blinks slowly, then curls up next to your feet as if nothing happened.
^You look at the corner one more time before turning off the light.
c-1: ^You turn off the light quickly, trying not to think about what cats might see that we can't.
^He stays still for a few more minutes before finally settling down to sleep.

Night_2_chaos: ^You wake up at 3 AM to complete chaos.
^Your phone has somehow made it to the floor.
^The curtains are swaying despite all windows being closed.
^The kitten sits innocently on the center of your chest, as if he had nothing to do with any of it.
Bedtime_2: ^Only to wake up at 3 AM to the sound of your phone hitting the carpet.
^The kitten sits on your nightstand, making direct eye contact.
^He slowly, deliberately, pushes your glass of water closer to the edge.
Morning_2_peaceful: ^You wake up naturally, just before your alarm, feeling well-rested.
^The kitten is still curled up at your feet, only stirring when he hears you move.
^He greets you with a tiny, sleepy "mrrp".
Morning_2: ^Morning comes, and with it, the realization that having a kitten is like living with a tiny adorable poltergeist.
^But when he curls up purring in your lap at breakfast, somehow it all seems worth it.
demo_finish: ^That's all for the game so far. Thank you for playing this demo!
^I'll be updating it soon with more days to play through, more events to discover, and of course, more of our furry friend! =)
toy_under_couch: ^You notice the kitten pawing desperately at something under the couch.

c-0: ^Cats will be cats. Nothing worth watching.
c-1: ^You peer under the couch and spot a candy wrapper. When you pull it out, the kitten's eyes light up like you've discovered buried treasure.

c-0: ^You toss it across the floor. He pounces on it with pure joy.
^The next few minutes are spent throwing the wrapper, watching him chase it down, and throwing it again.
^Eventually, he bats it back under the couch himself and wanders off. Mission accomplished.
c-1: ^The kitten watches mournfully as his newfound shiny toy disappears into the kitchen trash.
^Sorry little friend, but a clean house is more important than temporary entertainment.

b: ^a new episode of your favorite show
^an old movie that's somehow always on TV
^a nature documentary about birds that makes your kitten chirp
^a dramatic soap opera that makes no sense
^a true crime documentary that's strangely satisfying

watch_tv: ^You look at your TV... Maybe watch something for a while?

b: ^You hear a long, demanding meow and reluctantly turn off the TV.
^Someone needs dinner more than you need entertainment.
^The kitten keeps trying to catch everything moving on screen.
^Better turn off the TV before he knocks it over in his excitement.
^The kitten jumps into your lap, purring and rubbing against your cheek.
^Hard to focus on the show when someone is so desperately seeking attention. You give up and turn the TV off.
^It was a good one. Now, where did that cat go?..

c-1: ^You've got other things to do. Now, where did that cat go?..
